Class ExpenseController

java.lang.Object
ExpenseController
public class ExpenseController extends Object
Controller class that manages operations related to user expenses. It interacts with the ExpenseDataBase to perform CRUD operations.
Author:
Omar Sayed

  • Constructor Details

    • ExpenseController

      public ExpenseController(ExpenseDataBase database)
      Constructs an ExpenseController with the given database.
      Parameters:
      database - the ExpenseDataBase instance to be used

  • Method Details

    • addExpense

      public boolean addExpense(Expense expense)
      Adds a new expense to the database if the amount is greater than 0.
      Parameters:
      expense - the expense to be added
      Returns:
      true if the expense is valid and successfully saved; false otherwise

    • updateExpense

      public boolean updateExpense(Expense expense)
      Updates an existing expense in the database if it exists for the user.
      Parameters:
      expense - the expense object containing updated information
      Returns:
      true if the update is successful; false if the expense is not found

    • deleteExpense

      public boolean deleteExpense(int userId, int expenseId)
      Deletes an expense for a given user and expense ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user who owns the expense
      expenseId - the ID of the expense to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if the expense is found and deleted; false otherwise

    • listExpenses

      public List<Expense> listExpenses(int userId)
      Retrieves all expenses associated with a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user
      Returns:
      a list of expenses belonging to the user
